isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB DOOR AND HINGE

svcsubproc.title: Remove Driver Side Cab Door

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to an overhead hoist to support door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 37 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To disconnect electrical cable connections from cab to driver side cab door, remove cab front insulator panel (Item 1) under instrument panel by removing two black plastic trim fasteners (Item 2) from top flange, then remove one self tapping pan head screw and washer (Item 3) and remove front insulator panel.
Remove two pan head screws (Item 4) and remove dimmer switch (Item 5) to make it easier to remove cab side insulator panel (Item 6).

Remove cab side insulator panel (Item 6) on driver side by removing one black plastic trim fastener (Item 7) from top flange, then remove two self tapping pan head screws and washers (Item 8) and remove cab side insulator panel.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach under dash panel near outer cab wall and pull cable assembly down to access electrical cable connectors, disconnect courtesy light connector (Item 1) and CB cable connector (Item 2). If so equipped, disconnect electric window connector (Item 3) and electric door lock connector (Item 4). If vehicle is equipped with heated mirrors and/or electric mirrors, disconnect connectors for them also.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once connectors are disconnected, carefully pull electrical cable (Item 1) through side of cab (Item 2), cab hinge pillar (Item 3) and cab hinge pillar grommet (Item 4); each connector will have to be pulled through separately.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two pan head mach. screws (Item 1) securing cab door check strap (Item 2) to cab door frame (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 53 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cab door courtesy light switch (Item 1) by turning cab door courtesy light switch hex nut (Item 2) until cab door courtesy light switch and plastic washer is free from cab door (Item 3) and cab door hinge (Item 4). Pull cab door courtesy light switch out far enough to disconnect cab door courtesy light switch connector (Item 5).

Remove six hex flanged head bolts (Item 6) securing cab door hinge (Item 4) to cab door (Item 3) (top three hex flanged head bolts shown). Remove three hex flanged head bolts at bottom of hinge (not shown) and remove door from hinge.
Move door to a work bench or other support as required. Cover bench with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Driver Side Cab Door Hinge
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 53 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove cab door hinge (Item 7) at cab hinge pillar (Item 8), scribe position of cab door hinge at upper and lower corners of hinge on cab hinge pillar. This will help to position cab door hinge correctly when reinstalling cab door hinge to cab hinge pillar.

Remove six hex flanged head bolts (Item 9) securing cab door hinge (Item 7) to cab hinge pillar (Item 8) (top three hex flanged head bolts shown). Remove three hex flanged head bolts at bottom of hinge (not shown) and remove cab door hinge from cab hinge pillar.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Passenger Side Cab Door

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to an overhead hoist to support door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 45 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To disconnect electrical cable connections from cab to passenger side cab door, remove cab front insulator panel (Item 1) under instrument panel by removing three black plastic trim fasteners (Item 2) from top flange, then remove four self tapping pan head screws and washers (Item 3) and remove front insulator panel.
Remove cab side insulator panel (Item 4) on passenger side by removing two self tapping pan head screws and washer (Item 5).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 46 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach under dash panel near outer cab wall and pull cable assembly down to access electrical cable connectors. Disconnect courtesy light connector (Item 1) and CB cable connector (Item 2). If so equipped, disconnect electric window connector (Item 3) and electric door lock connector (Item 4). If vehicle is equipped with heated mirrors and/or electric mirrors, disconnect connectors for them also.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 47 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once connectors are disconnected, carefully pull electrical cable (Item 1) through side of cab (Item 2), cab hinge pillar (Item 3) and cab hinge pillar grommet (Item 4); each connector will have to be pulled through separately.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 48 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two pan head mach. screws (Item 1) securing cab door check strap (Item 2) to cab door frame (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 54 for Items in parentheses.

Pull cab door courtesy light switch out far enough to disconnect cab door courtesy light switch connector (Item 5).

Remove six hex flanged head bolts (Item 6) securing cab door hinge (Item 4) to cab door (Item 3) (top three hex flanged head bolts shown). Remove three hex flanged head bolts at bottom of hinge (not shown) and remove door from hinge.
Move door to a work bench or other support as required. Cover bench with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door.
